taskDescription:
A large plastic storage bin has dimensions of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>16</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mn>16</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mn>16</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">16\,{\text{cm}} \times 16\,{\text{cm}} \times 16\,{\text{cm}}</annotation></semantics></math>. A medium bin’s dimensions are half the size of the large bin. A small bin’s dimensions are the size of the medium bin. If the storage bins come in a set of 3—small, medium, and large—what is the total volume of the storage bin set in cubic centimeters?
